payload.name: fermi-order-of-magnitude
payload.core: Rough quantitative estimates via decomposition and bounding; aims for scale correctness rather than precision.
proc: decompose unknown quantity into estimable components
estimate each component with rough bounds
identify dominant terms driving the result
check: result within expected order of magnitude?

diff.vs_qualitative: produces numeric estimates, not just directional trends
diff.vs_reference_class: decomposes from scratch rather than anchoring to base rates

fail.desc: unit mistakes or implicit assumptions left untested; errors in component estimates compound multiplicatively

use: identifying dominant cost or risk terms

ex.scenario: estimating annual piano tuner demand in a city
ex.approach: decompose: population -> pianos per household -> tunings per year -> time per tuning -> tuners needed; yields order-of-magnitude answer
